paper_abstract: By etching slots in the low-impedance section of the conventional stepped-impedance resonator, a novel slotted stepped-impedance resonator (SSIR) is proposed. As two examples, a fourth-order bandpass filter (BPF) operating at 1 GHz with a size of 0.078 lambda(g) x 0.062 lambda(g) and a miniaturized diplexer operating at 0.9/1.57 GHz with a size of 0.054 lambda(0) x 0.086 lambda(0) are designed based on the proposed SSIR. The fabricated BPF exhibits a high selectivity and a wide -30 dB rejection upper stopband from 1.13 f(0) to 6.52 f(0), while the fabricated diplexer has up to -60 dB output isolation. (C) 2012 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Int J RF and Microwave CAE 23: 208-216, 2013.
paper_title: Novel Slotted Stepped-Impedance Resonator and Its Application to Compact and High Performance Bandpass Filter and Diplexer Design
